solution_line_template: There are {weekday_classes_per_day} classes x {num_weekdays} days = <<{weekday_classes_per_day}*{num_weekdays}={weekday_classes}>>{weekday_classes} classes on weekdays.
There are {weekend_classes_per_day} classes x {num_weekend_days} days = <<{weekend_classes_per_day}*{num_weekend_days}={weekend_classes}>>{weekend_classes} classes on weekends.
There are a total of {weekday_classes} + {weekend_classes} = <<{weekday_classes}+{weekend_classes}={total_classes_per_week}>>{total_classes_per_week} classes per week.
So each week, {total_classes_per_week} x {people_per_class} = <<{total_classes_per_week}*{people_per_class}={people_per_week}>>{people_per_week} people can take classes.
Thus, {people_per_week} x {num_weeks} = <<{people_per_week}*{num_weeks}={answer}>>{answer} people can take classes in 3 weeks.
